alert.note: Alert for Clark (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 18 at 9:51AM EST until February 19 at 8:30PM EST by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Lingering flooding caused by previous excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of Central Ohio and West Central Ohio, including the following counties, in Central Ohio, Fairfield, Fayette OH, Hocking and Pickaway. In West Central Ohio, Clark. * WHEN...Until 600 PM EST Friday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Numerous roads remain closed due to flooding. Low-water crossings are inundated with water and may not be passable. Expect many areas of slow moving or standing water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 950 AM EST, local law enforcement reported flooding and high water lingering in numerous locations across the warned area. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Columbus, Springfield, Lancaster, Reynoldsburg, Fairborn, Pickerington, Washington Court House, Circleville, Logan, New Carlisle, Northridge, Wright-Patterson Afb, Canal Winchester, Nelsonville, Ashville, Baltimore, Buckeye Lake, Enon, Mount Sterling and South Bloomfield.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. To report flooding, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
